definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
erhua variant of 兩頭|两头[liang3 tou2]
erhua variant of 挑頭|挑头[tiao3 tou2]
erhua variant of 奔頭|奔头[ben4 tou5]
erhua variant of 年頭|年头[nian2 tou2]
erhua variant of 料頭|料头[liao4 tou2]
erhua variant of 沒有勁頭|没有劲头[mei2 you3 jin4 tou2]
erhua variant of 煙頭|烟头[yan1 tou2]
(coll.) the reward of one's efforts/the light at the end of the tunnel
erhua variant of 癮頭|瘾头[yin3 tou2]

sentences.english: A weak small spare old man.
The Big Kahoona question me to work the weekend to get an importance report finiITd.
sentences.chinese: 那个周末头儿要我任务，完成一份很重要的报告。

sentences.english: The old man looked meditatively at the darts board.
sentences.chinese: 老头儿沉思不语，看着那投镖板。

sentences.english: "Light your lanthorn, old man, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “老头儿，把你的灯笼点亮，”他说。

sentences.english: This young chap is very tall.
Then, you know, it had something spiny head.
sentences.chinese: 然后，你知道的，它有个尖尖的刺头儿。

sentences.english: Run for the doctor,the old man is dying.
sentences.chinese: 这个老头儿不行了，赶快去找医生。

sentences.english: This kind of watermelon is remarkable for its size.
The twins are of equal height.
sentences.chinese: 这对双胞胎个头儿一样高。

sentences.english: As for getting a feel for the life of locals, Wang Yuanyuan has more enthusiasm than me.
sentences.chinese: 要说感受市民的生活，王渊源的劲头儿可比我要大。

sentences.english: The newcomers will have some of the most enviable jobs in academia.
sentences.chinese: 这些新头儿们将拥有学术界中最令人羡慕的工作。

sentences.english: What is your name, old man?
's years since we've seen each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们有年头儿没见面了。

sentences.english: Now tell me, does your market leader know that you are here?
sentences.chinese: 告诉我，你的市场头儿知道你在这里吗？

sentences.english: The gang are screaming for the immediate release of their leader.
sentences.chinese: 那帮人吵嚷著要求立即释放他们的头儿。

definition: elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
(affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
